intro: Struthiopteris gilliesii, commonly known as the giant shield fern, is a large, robust fern native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its tall, upright fronds that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The plant has a distinctive, shield-shaped structure at the base of its fronds, which is a key identifying feature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Struthiopteris gilliesii plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various forest organisms.
